issues.title: Elements must meet minimum color contrast ratio thresholds
issues.description: Ensure the contrast between foreground and background colors meets WCAG 2 AA minimum contrast ratio thresholds

any.message: Element has insufficient color contrast of 2.74 (foreground color: #2ea3f2, background color: #ffffff, font size: 10.5pt (14px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has insufficient color contrast of 2.74 (foreground color: #2ea3f2, background color: #ffffff, font size: 10.5pt (14px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

issues.title: This element has insufficient contrast at this conformance level. Expected a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, but text in this element has a contrast ratio of 2.75:1. Recommendation:  change text colour to #057ac9.

original_issue.message: This element has insufficient contrast at this conformance level. Expected a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, but text in this element has a contrast ratio of 2.75:1. Recommendation:  change text colour to #057ac9.
original_issue.selector: #post-433 > div:nth-child(2) > div > div > div > ul > li:nth-child(1) > a > span

issues.title: This element has insufficient contrast at this conformance level. Expected a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, but text in this element has a contrast ratio of 2.75:1. Recommendation:  change text colour to #057ac9.

issues.title: Background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.
issues.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. [Learn how to provide sufficient color contrast](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/color-contrast).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has insufficient color contrast of 2.74 (foreground color: #2ea3f2, background color: #ffffff, font size: 27.4pt (36.5617px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 3:1

automatic_issues.name: Headings; Wrong Order, Empty & Missing Headings;

issues.title: Heading levels should only increase by one
issues.description: Ensure the order of headings is semantically correct

any.message: Heading order invalid

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  Heading order invalid

issues.title: Heading tag found with no content. Text that is not intended as a heading should not be marked up with heading tags.

original_issue.message: Heading tag found with no content. Text that is not intended as a heading should not be marked up with heading tags.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div:nth-child(3) > div > div:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(1) > div:nth-child(2) > h2

issues.title: Heading tag found with no content. Text that is not intended as a heading should not be marked up with heading tags.

issues.title: Heading tag found with no content. Text that is not intended as a heading should not be marked up with heading tags.

original_issue.message: Heading tag found with no content. Text that is not intended as a heading should not be marked up with heading tags.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div:nth-child(3) > div > div:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(2) > div > div:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(1) > div:nth-child(1) > h3

issues.title: Heading elements are not in a sequentially-descending order
issues.description: Properly ordered headings that do not skip levels convey the semantic structure of the page, making it easier to navigate and understand when using assistive technologies. [Learn more about heading order](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/heading-order).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Heading order invalid

issues.title: <html> element must have a lang attribute
issues.description: Ensure every HTML document has a lang attribute

any.message: The <html> element does not have a lang attribute

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  The <html> element does not have a lang attribute

issues.title: The html element should have a lang or xml:lang attribute which describes the language of the document.

original_issue.message: The html element should have a lang or xml:lang attribute which describes the language of the document.

issues.title: `<html>` element does not have a `[lang]` attribute
issues.description: If a page doesn't specify a `lang` attribute, a screen reader assumes that the page is in the default language that the user chose when setting up the screen reader. If the page isn't actually in the default language, then the screen reader might not announce the page's text correctly. [Learn more about the `lang` attribute](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/html-has-lang).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  The <html> element does not have a lang attribute

issues.title: Image elements do not have `[alt]` attributes
issues.description: Informative elements should aim for short, descriptive alternate text. Decorative elements can be ignored with an empty alt attribute. [Learn more about the `alt` attribute](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/image-alt).
